items.text: looks to tuck the ball behind square leg. He does so, but off his pads
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Nurse, 2 leg byes

items.text: gets up off his toes to pull the short ball on middle to long leg
items.postText: Stiaan: "The Windies team can be so frustrating to watch when they play odi's. One day they'll fire like it's nobody's business, the other they are scraping runs and bat like Peter Kirsten (in his prime, averaging a strike rate of maximum 50). "

items.text: slower yorker on leg stump, Reifer turns it to midwicket to get his first runs in ODIs
back of a length and outside off, he dabs at it, the ball doesn't even go off the square, but they pinch a single even as Mushfiqur runs up from behind the stumps to try to stop them
items.postText: Shivam: "Bangladesh should complete the quota of Abu Jayed and see how he bowls in the death overs... otherwise no point of him being in the team and world cup squad"

items.preText:
Syed Kabir: "Every single game I see atleast one comment here criticizing Mashrafe's ability and every single time he delivers with crucial wickets. Very similar to Dhoni's critics. " ------ Mohammad Isam has a reply for you: ""Mashrafe knows it all too well. He thrives on criticism."

Neeraj: "Mortaza getting a bit selfish here, looking for a five-for may be. He should have given the ball to Fizz, but he din't which means Fizz won't complete his quota of ten overs, after coming back to form after such a long time he deserved to finish his all ten and get a few more wickets may be to add to his confidence."
items.text: goes short and Nurse hammers it to deep square leg, well to the right of the man, but Sabbir does wonderfully down there
slower ball sneaks through between bat and pad as Reifer attempts a tentative poke. Bounces in front of the keeper and the resulting fumble allows a bye
pulls the top-pace short ball to deep square leg
shapes to pull a back of a length ball but it sneaks under the bat and through to Mushfiqur
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Reifer, no run

items.text: back of a length and outside off, Reifer blocks it, after having been surprised by the extra bounce, but he does secure the single

gets a top edge and a fairly good bouncer, climbing up at Nurse's nose, and making him drag it from outside off with his pull shot - essentially everything you're told while bowling a bouncer in the final overs - ends up going against the bowler.
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Nurse, FOUR runs

items.preText: amzad: "if Mashrafi could have a injury free career, and can exploit the talent he have,he could be one of the great fast bowlers specially in ODI cricket.He is the most popular cricket in Bangladesh and he is a great human being, he is a great leader as well. Respect for you Big Mash."
items.text: flicks a length ball through midwicket
slower ball on off stump, he tucks it behind square leg
steers a back of a length delivery outside off behind point
gets down the pitch but Mashrafe adjusts well, bowling the offcutter into the pitch and making the batsman mis-hit the flick. Inside edge off the pads ends up by the pitch
items.postText: Ravi jindal: "Not really a fan of Jason Holder as an ODI hitter. Hez a good test match player but i doubt if he should be even playing in one dayers. "

items.text: comes down the track again but without too much room on offer he can only flat bat a short ball down to long-on
full on off stump, defends
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Nurse, no run

items.text: lifts an attempted yorker on leg stump over to deep square leg

goes high but not long and Sabbir is under that at deep midwicket; he's had a good day in the field and he wraps it up with a fine catch. Mustafizur strikes again, thanks to that brilliant slower ball. Pitches on leg stump. The batsman is too early into the shot and loses his shape. That's why it goes so high instead of long and well... the rest is fairly basic
items.postText: Johnny: "Jason Holder is not a hitter. He's a skilled batsman should should be batting in the top order like Jacques kallis did for SA. Drop one of the useless middle order bats and bring in another finisher to support Andre Russell. This should be the end of Darren Bravo ODI career. We have too many promising young players to keep trying to fit him into the ODI team."

dismissal.text: AR Nurse c Sabbir Rahman b Mustafizur Rahman 14 (22m 12b 1x4 0x6) SR: 116.66

items.text: yorker, veering into the left-hander's toes. Reifer flicks it to long-on
opens the face and steers a full delivery outside off to deep third man

huge appeal for lbw and up goes the finger again. Reifer is pinned in front of middle, surprised by the ball at the Fizz's top pace. It pitches on off stump and skids into him, making him play across the line to midwicket, and miss his shot. The impact is highish on the front pad, but he's stuck deep in his crease and looks pretty much out

dismissal.text: RA Reifer lbw b Mustafizur Rahman 7 (22m 12b 0x4 0x6) SR: 58.33

items.text: almost knocks off stump out! It's the cutter again, pitching outside leg, beating Cottrell's wild, down-the-pitch slog. All it needs to do is hit the target but there is so much spin on the ball that it just skirts past
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Cottrell, no run

items.preText: Abhijato: "Jason Holder belongs in the middle overs, especially on tough pitches. As the last fifty deliveries or so proved when he made that double century v England, he is a natural timer of ball but not a natural hitter, if you get what I mean. Timing is more of his thing. He can be a floating anchor, coming in whenever his team needs him to in the early stages of a match. Once he's faced enough balls, I believe he has the ability to launch the ball every erring ball efficiently. #FloatHolderUpTheOrder"
items.text: length ball on off stump, he gets across to defend
lifts a full delivery on middle away to deep midwicket
items.postText: Reza: "Just wondering about the Pitch today. Is it hard to bat on? Or should the Bangladeshi bowlers have done well than the WI Batsmen?" --- It is slightly slow, but West indies didn't really do themselves any favours in the middle overs, playing their spinners with no real plan except to not get out to them. There was no effort to get runs

items.text: beautiful slower ball. Roach has no clue where it is, looking one side and the next as his flick is beaten and he's hit on the thigh pad. Only when Mashrafe rushes forward to where silly point might have been does he realise where the ball is
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to Roach, 1 leg bye
